item.description:
Gattaca Tuesday, January 10, 2012 7PM

This science fiction drama is set in a future when one's life is determined by genetic engineering rather than education or experience.

Before the film Dr. Gualberto Ruaño will talk about DNA guided medicine, based on genomics and clinical informatics, to diagnose and manage viral infectious diseases.  Dr. Ruaño is a pioneer in the field of personalized medicine and the inventor of molecular diagnostic systems used worldwide for the management of viral diseases. Dr. Ruaño is the Director of Genetics Research at Hartford Hospital. He received the 2005 Medical Technology Award by the Biomedical Engineering Alliance of Connecticut.

 

 

Science on Screen creatively pairs area scientists with entertaining films.   For more information about the series, go to:  http://www.realartways.org/science-on-screen.html
item.how_to_find_us: I will wear a red coat and be knitting.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: Science on Screen: "Gattaca"
